item.title: afghan army takes the lead in zabul
item.description: in one of afghanistan's poorest provinces, the country's forces are beginning to handle security, relations with the people and even dispute resolution.

item.title: earthquake rattles mexico city, buildings shake
item.description: a strong earthquake rattled the mexican capital on thursday but there were no reports of damage.

item.title: mets' young goes on the disabled list
item.description: the right-handed pitcher will miss at least two starts. pat misch was called up to cover the mets in the bullpen for saturday's doubleheader.

item.title: u.s. won't become isolationist, gates tells worried asian leaders
item.description: defense secretary robert m. gates pledged that the united states would sustain its military presence and diplomatic involvement in asia.

item.title: statistic combines physics and luck
item.description: hitters' averages on balls in play still fluctuate wildly from year to year, and many of today's players understand the statistic's inherent volatility.

item.title: in afghan kilns, a cycle of debt and servitude
item.description: tens of thousands of afghans are trapped in a seemingly endless cycle of poverty that keeps them indebted to their employers.

item.title: red bull plans lifestyle magazine
item.description: red bull, now trying to become a media player, will publish a lifestyle magazine.

item.title: wyclef jean 'doing well' after being shot in hand in haiti
item.description: wyclef jean has been released from a hospital in haiti after being treated for a gunshot wound to his hand.

item.title: spreading wildfires in texas destroy homes
item.description: crews battled more than 65,000 acres of wildfires on sunday that caused the evacuation of a west texas town, destroyed 90 homes and critically injured a firefighter.

item.title: recipes for health: building a better breadstick
item.description: whole-grain breadsticks are easy to make at home and better for you than those found in restaurants.

item.title: schiavone advances after peng retires
item.description: pushing her opponent from sideline to sideline paid off for francesca schiavone of italy, the defending french open champion, who reached the fourth round friday when her opponent, shuai peng of china, was forced to withdraw with a leg injury.

item.title: oil price falls as investors dump commodities
item.description: a move to safer assets sends american crude oil below $100 a barrel for the first time in two weeks.

item.title: texas wildfires destroy homes, buildings
item.description: wildfires scorched more than 230,000 acres in texas on sunday, roaring through a west texas town, destroying an estimated 80 homes and buildings and critically injuring a firefighter.

item.title: plains: kansas: lawmaker apologizes for immigrant quip
item.description: a republican lawmaker has apologized for a remark suggesting ' as a joke, he said ' that illegal immigrants should be shot like feral swine.

item.title: tibetan monk burns to death in china protest: group
item.description: a tibetan buddhist monk burned himself to death in western china on wednesday, triggering a street protest against government controls on the restive region, a group campaigning for tibetan self-rule said.

item.title: could stomach 'pacemaker' be new weight-loss tool?
item.description: silke zeigler was fed up with "yo-yo" dieting in her struggle to maintain a healthy weight.

item.title: rose says hill to help support new charter school
item.description: former michigan basketball star jalen rose says grant hill has agreed to help support the new charter school in detroit bearing rose's name.

item.title: nadal beats ferrer for seventh monte carlo crown
item.description: rafa nadal continued his extraordinary love affair with the monte carlo masters by sealing his seventh straight title on the monaco clay after a 6-4 7-5 win over fellow spaniard david ferrer on sunday.

item.title: spain's nadal and ferrer reach monte carlo final
item.description: spaniards rafa nadal and david ferrer will lock horns again in the monte carlo masters final after the claycourt conquistadors sealed contrasting victories in their semi-finals on saturday.

item.title: melzer puts wind up beaten federer as nadal wins
item.description: roger federer was blown away 6-4 6-4 by juergen melzer in the monte carlo masters quarter-finals but rafa nadal stormed through as the gap between the two great rivals widened further friday.

item.title: apple ipad 2 parts said squeezed by japan quake: report
item.description: apple inc may face shortages of key components for its newly-released ipad 2 as a result of the earthquake in japan, according to a report released on thursday.

item.title: gadhafi forces controlling key libyan city
item.description: showing growing confidence, moammar gadhafi's regime celebrated friday after retaking a strategic city near tripoli following days of shelling ...

item.title: drug-resistant tb to afflict 2 million by 2015: who
item.description: over two million people will contract a form of tuberculosis (tb) resistant to standard drugs by 2015 and the fight against it must be stepped up, the world health organization said on wednesday.

item.title: strongman and stability guide kazakhs in vote
item.description: during a season of collapsing authoritarian regimes, kazakhstan's president stands as testament to the forces protecting the strongmen of the former soviet states.

item.title: yemen's opposition accepts deal for transfer of power
item.description: questions remain about the terms of the plan and whether the street protesters will accept it.

item.title: greece nears imf/eu deal and dismisses drachma talk
item.description: greece should complete talks by the end of the week with eu and imf inspectors on a medium-term budget plan plus a vital next slice of international aid, sources close to the negotiations said on wednesday.

item.title: blast injures 10 in pakistan's north waziristan
item.description: a blast at a restaurant in pakistan's tribal north waziristan region near the afghan border wounded ten people on monday, officials said.

item.title: stay away from energy drinks, doctors say
item.description: in a new report, a large group of american doctors urge kids and teens to avoid energy drinks and only consume sports drinks in limited amount.

item.description: sepp blatter's presidency of fifa, soccer's world governing body, is being challenged by mohamed bin hammam, and perhaps others.

item.description: 'idol' judge, aerosmith frontman looks back in 'does the noise in my head bother you?'

item.title: san diego family left suicide notes in apparent drownings
item.description: police said on wednesday they are investigating the apparent drowning deaths of a family of four in san diego as a murder-suicide case after finding at least two suicide notes in their house.

item.title: pakistan conveys concern to kabul after militant raid
item.description: pakistan called on thursday for stern action against militants in afghanistan by afghan and u.s.-led foreign forces after 27 pakistani forces were killed in a cross-border attack by militants.

item.title: egypt military says presidential election this year
item.description: egypt will elect a new president by the end of the year, the ruling military council said on wednesday, laying out more details of the political transition which egyptians hope will produce a democratic government.

item.title: bb biotech backs actelion in battle with elliott
item.description: biotech investment fund bb biotech has come out in support of actelion ltd, giving the swiss biotech group crucial backing in its spat with its largest shareholder elliott advisors.

item.title: martin luther king's daughter leaves atlanta megachurch
item.description: bernice king, the daughter of the late civil rights leader martin luther king jr., has left a suburban atlanta megachurch that has been at the center of a recent sex controversy, and plans to start her own ministry.

item.title: bahrain says suspends opposition paper over "lies"
item.description: bahrain suspended the gulf arab state's main opposition newspaper on sunday, after accusing it of falsifying news about sectarian unrest and a government crackdown on protests.

item.title: bb biotech backs actelion in fight with elliott
item.description: bb biotech, one of the biggest investors in actelion, is backing the swiss drugmaker's board and management in a battle with activist hedge fund elliott advisors, according to the financial times.

item.title: clijsters cruises, murray ousted by qualifier in key biscayne
item.description: defending champion kim clijsters needed only 50 minutes to win her opening match friday at the sony ericsson open.

item.title: libyans lack food, health care: aid agencies
item.description: libyans increasingly lack access to medical care and life-saving drugs, and food prices are rocketing as the conflict deepens, aid agencies said on tuesday.

item.title: analysis: sony's breach a hiccup to online game phenomenon
item.description: when service was finally restored to sony corp's playstation network earlier this month, millions of customers rushed back to it, impatient to get back to battling friends in sports or shooter games.

item.description: the health authorities in europe stepped up efforts to halt the deadly outbreak as a dispute broke out between spain and germany over the source of the illness.

item.title: juror in rajaratnam trial is replaced
item.description: after a week of deliberations, a juror in the insider trading trial of raj rajaratnam was excused for health reasons and the judge told the jury that it must now begin anew.

item.description: the decline in the use of nicknames is most easily gauged in sports, where they have long played a role in distinguishing athletes.

item.description: mr. schlafly, an electrical engineer, formed the teleprompter corporation with two colleagues after 20th century fox declined to invest in their device.

item.title: more evidence ties cholesterol drug, diabetes
item.description: people on a high-dose regimen of the cholesterol drug lipitor may have a slightly increased risk of developing type 2 diabetes -- particularly if they have several of the classic diabetes risk factors, a study published monday finds.

item.description: darnell stapleton, 25, who won a title with the 2008 steelers, is the new coach of the new york sharks of the women's football alliance.

item.description: the founders of foursquare were among those receiving made in ny awards on tuesday.

item.description: a new york times/cbs news poll finds that only 6 percent of americans have been closely following news on next week's nuptials.

item.description: a quarterback named palmer has taken the lead rounding up members of the cincinnati bengals for voluntary workouts during the nfl lockout.

item.title: taliban stop cell phone signals in key afghan province
item.description: mobile phones have fallen silent in afghanistan's southern helmand province on the orders of the taliban, telecoms engineers said, a potent reminder of insurgent power in an area chosen as the showcase for a transition to afghan security.
